alert.note: Alert for Van Zandt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 7:30AM CDT until October 26 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Parts of Kaufman, Rains, and Van Zandt counties in North Texas. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Terrell, Kaufman, Canton, Wills Point, Grand Saline, Mabank, Van, Seven Points, Edgewood, Emory, Kemp, East Tawakoni, Point, Fruitvale, Edom, Lake Tawakoni State Park, Purtis Creek State Park, Lake Tawakoni, New Terrell City Lake and Cedar Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
